sense.def:
One's senses
so telesne zmožnosti videnja, vohanja, slišanja, dotikanja in okušanja.

seg.quote: They all have an excellent sense of smell.

sense.def:
To sense something
pomeni začeti se nečesa zavedati, čeprav tisto ni zelo očitno.

seg.quote: Doctors often sense uneasiness in people.
He sensed that she did not want to talk to him.

sense.def:
To have a sense of guilt or shame
pomeni občutiti na primer krivdo ali sram.

seg.quote: I was overcome by a sense of failure.

sense.def:
To have a sense of duty or justice
pomeni znati ločiti, kaj je naša dolžnost ali kaj je pravično.

seg.quote: She has a strong sense of justice.

sense.def:
To have a sense of timing or style
pomeni imeti prirojen občutek za pravi trenutek ali eleganco.

seg.quote: A good sense of timing is important for an actor.
He hasn't got much dress sense.

sense.def:
Sense
je sposobnost razumnega presojanja in preudarnega vedênja.

seg.quote: She had the good sense to realize that the plan would never work.

sense.def:
A sense of a word or expression
je eden izmed možnih pomenov besede ali izraza.

seg.quote: I don't like the Washington climate—in all senses of the word.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
makes sense
ali kadar nekdo
can make sense of something
, tisto nekomu uspe razumeti.

seg.quote: I looked at the page but the words made no sense.
You had to read it six times to make any sense of it.

sense.def:
Kadar neko dejanje
makes sense
, se zdi smiselno.

seg.quote: Under these conditions it made sense to adopt labour-saving methods.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
has come to one's senses
ali
has been brought to one's senses
, se neha vesti nerazumno.

cit.quote: priti k pameti; spraviti k pameti

sense.def:
Kadar rečemo, da je nekaj res
in a sense
, mislimo, da je delno res.

seg.quote: In a sense, I still love him.
